byline.contributor: Rukmini Callimachi reported from Munich, Melissa Eddy from Berlin, and Andrew Jacobs from New York. Reporting was contributed by Gregor Aisch, Victor Homola and Franziska Reymann from Berlin; Jack Ewing from Locarno, Switzerland; Sewell Chan and Christopher D. Shea from London; and Ainara Tiefenthäler from New York.
byline.original: By RUKMINI CALLIMACHI, MELISSA EDDY and ANDREW JACOBS

abstract: Gunman opens fire inside Munich, Germany, shopping mall, killing nine people and wounding 21 others; authorities believe work was from single gunman, who was later found dead from self-inflicted gunshot to head; motive for attack is unclear.
lead_paragraph: The police said the attack outside a mall was probably the work of a single gunman. At least 21 people were wounded.

headline.main: Gunman in Munich Kills 9, Then Himself, the Police Say
headline.print_headline: Shooting Rampage Leaves a Trail of Dead and Paralyzes Munich

snippet: The police said the attack outside a mall was probably the work of a single gunman. At least 21 people were wounded....
